snippet: Mr. Trump appeared to broaden his proposed ban on Muslim immigrants, while Hillary Clinton accused him of damaging efforts to defeat terrorism.
abstract: Donald J Trump again proposes to ban Muslim immigrants from entering United States in wake of massacre in Orlando, Fla, while Hillary Clinton delivers more conventional speech that focuses on importance of building relationships between law enforcement agencies and American Muslims; some Republicans warn that Trump’s determination to play to his hard-line base will hurt his standing as general election candidate.

byline.original: By JONATHAN MARTIN and ALEXANDER BURNS
byline.contributor: Amy Chozick, Julia Preston and Alan Rappeport contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Trump appeared to broaden his proposed ban on Muslim immigrants, while Hillary Clinton accused him of damaging efforts to defeat terrorism.

headline.main: Blaming Muslims After Attack, Donald Trump Tosses Pluralism Aside
headline.print_headline: Branding Muslims as Threats, Trump Tosses Pluralism Aside
